alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Chesterfield, southwestern Prince George and northeastern Dinwiddie Counties, the City of Colonial Heights and the City of Petersburg through 630 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Petersburg, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Petersburg around 605 PM EDT. Virginia State University around 610 PM EDT. Matoaca and Ettrick around 615 PM EDT. Colonial Heights around 620 PM EDT. Sutherland around 625 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include New Bohemia, Center Star, Petersburg Airport, Church Road, Five Forks, Richard Bland College, Burgess, Templeton, Addison and Reams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Prince George
